If youâre interested in working in my lab as a PhD student or PostDoc. I also have several projects for visiting and local students available. Please find more details here. I am a faculty member at CISPA Helmholtz Center for Information Security in Saarbrucken, Germany. I am interested in building secure, practical, and privacy-friendly systems using applied cryptography, anonymous communication, and systemâs engineering. Before, I was a postdoctoral researcher at EPFL, Switzerland where I had the pleasure to collaborate with Carmela Troncoso in the SPRING lab. I completed my PhD at the Radboud University, the Netherlands, where I was advised by Jaap-Henk Hoepman and Bart Jacobs. During my PhD studies I visited Ian Goldberg at the University of Waterloo, Canada.
